name: Blue Whale
Description: Blue whales are baleen whales known for their massive size, deep blue-grey color, and loud calls that can travel thousands of kilometers underwater.

name: Orca
Description: Often called 'killer whales', orcas are black and white marine mammals with strong family bonds and diverse hunting techniques.

name: Great White Shark
Description: The great white shark is a powerful predator with a torpedo-shaped body and rows of sharp teeth, making it one of the most recognizable shark species.

name: Tuna
Description: Tuna are streamlined, fast-swimming fish prized in commercial fisheries. They are known for their ability to regulate body temperature, aiding their speed and endurance.

name: Salmon
Description: Salmon are known for their incredible migrations and importance to freshwater and marine ecosystems. They are a key food source for many predators, including bears and humans.

name: Humpback Whale
Description: Humpback whales are baleen whales famous for their breaching behavior and long pectoral fins. They migrate vast distances between feeding and breeding grounds.

name: Dolphins
Description: Dolphins are marine mammals with streamlined bodies and a playful nature. They are known for their intelligence, echolocation abilities, and friendly interactions with humans.

name: Cod
Description: Cod are commercially important fish known for their mild flavor. They inhabit cooler waters and are vital to many marine ecosystems and human industries.

name: Lobster
Description: Lobsters are invertebrates with a hard exoskeleton and large claws. They are known for their ability to regenerate lost limbs and for being a prized seafood delicacy.

name: Shark
Description: Sharks are cartilaginous fish with sharp teeth and keen senses. They are critical to ocean health, controlling prey populations and maintaining balance.

name: Dugongs
Description: Dugongs, often called 'sea cows', are marine mammals closely related to manatees. They are vital for maintaining healthy seagrass ecosystems.

name: Whale Sharks
Description: The whale shark is the largest fish species. Its unique spotted pattern makes it easily recognizable, and it migrates across vast distances in tropical oceans.

name: Clownfish
Description: Known for their bright orange bodies with white stripes, clownfish are small, colorful fish made famous by the movie Finding Nemo.

name: Sea Snakes
Description: Sea snakes are adapted to marine life with paddle-like tails for swimming. They can breathe through their skin, allowing extended dives.

name: Crabs
Description: Crabs are crustaceans with hard exoskeletons and pincers. They play an important role in both marine and coastal ecosystems and are a significant food source for humans.

name: Emperor Penguins
Nature: Social and highly adapted to cold
Description: Emperor penguins are the largest penguin species. They are known for their endurance in Antarctica’s freezing climate and their unique parenting behaviors.

name: Leopard Seals
Description: Leopard seals are sleek and agile predators in Antarctic waters. They are named for their spotted coats and fierce hunting tactics.

name: Krill
Description: Krill are small, shrimp-like crustaceans found in massive swarms in polar oceans. They are vital to marine ecosystems and are one of the most abundant species on Earth.

name: Blue Whales
Description: Blue whales are the largest animals ever to live on Earth, known for their immense size, deep calls, and role in maintaining the ocean's ecosystem balance.

name: Polar Bears
Description: Polar bears are powerful Arctic mammals adapted to icy environments with thick fur and a layer of fat for insulation. They are iconic symbols of Arctic ecosystems but are vulnerable due to climate change.

name: Walruses
Description: Walruses are large marine mammals with distinctive tusks and whiskers. They play a key role in Arctic ecosystems and rely heavily on sea ice for resting and breeding.

name: Narwhals
Description: Narwhals are medium-sized toothed whales often called the 'unicorns of the sea'. Their tusks can grow up to 3 meters (10 feet) and are thought to play a role in sensing the environment or social dominance.

name: Arctic Foxes
Description: Arctic foxes are small mammals with thick fur that changes color (white in winter, brown in summer) to blend with their environment. They are highly adapted to cold climates and are important scavengers in Arctic ecosystems.
